To implement the Java code I provided: 1-Create a new directory and name it rpc.
2-Inside the rpc directory
you can follow these steps:: create a new directory and name it server.

To implement the Java code I provided: 3-Inside the server directory
you can follow these steps:: create a new file and name it Server.java.

To implement the Java code I provided: 4-Copy and paste the server code I provided into the Server.java file.
5-Save the Server.java file.
6-Open a command prompt or terminal window and navigate to the rpc/server directory.
7-Type javac Server.java and press Enter to compile the server.
8-Type java Server and press Enter to start the server. You should see a message indicating that the server is running.
9-Open a new command prompt or terminal window and navigate to the rpc directory.
10-Inside the rpc directory
you can follow these steps:: create a new directory and name it client.

To implement the Java code I provided: 11-Inside the client directory
you can follow these steps:: create a new file and name it Client.java.

To implement the Java code I provided: 12-Copy and paste the client code I provided into the Client.java file.
13-Save the Client.java file.
14-Open a command prompt or terminal window and navigate to the rpc/client directory.
15-Type javac Client.java and press Enter to compile the client.
16-Type java Client and press Enter to run the client.
You should see the result of the addNumbers function call (5) printed to the console.
Note that you will need to have the Java Development Kit (JDK) installed on your computer in order to compile
and run this code. You can download the JDK from the Oracle website.
Also
you can follow these steps:: make sure that you have set the JAVA_HOME environment variable to the path of your JDK installation.
